author: larry
post: >>There is a segment of Christianity that pushes a Christian triumphalism and the Shroud could be be exploited by them<< A question: why is it okay to routinely characterize Christians in this way, but we must all subscribe to the idea that the original C 14 scientists were all "honest men"?.I'm not saying they weren't, but even Thomas De Wesselow in his book "The Sign"(which argues against a literal Resurrection and can't be characterized as "pro Christian" ) says that fraud could have been involved in the 1988 tests. I have no idea what happened, or why. But it's disconcerting to see Christians characterized as "triumphalistic" when we live in a world where people see scientists as infallible, and where Christians barely speak up for their rights in an increasingly hostile world..
title: Several Mark Antonacci  Talks in St. Louis  Starting Next Week
